pr_title: HHH-14329 Test and fix for DirtinessTracker usage for enhanced entities doesn't respect mutable types

timeline.bodyText:
This looks a bit scary, but after reading through it it seems all it does is a union Set of the indexes of mutable properties + the ids of the named attributes.
Did I read that correctly? Maybe we could add an implementation comment?
timeline.author: Sanne

replies.bodyText: I will adapt the implementation a bit as it is not 100% correct yet. Working on it atm.
replies.author: beikov

timeline.bodyText: You think we could use BitSet(s) to track such things?  Probably not worth our time here, but I'd like to take that in consideration in ORM 6.
timeline.author: Sanne

replies.bodyText: Yeah, a BitSet is a good candidate for something like that.
replies.author: beikov

timeline.message: HHH-14329 test case showing that DirtinessTracker usage for enhanced entities doesn't respect mutable types
HHH-14329 consider mutable types always as potentially dirty when using DirtinessTracker
